revised_title: Investigation of the Mechanism of Adhesion in the Lacerta Gecko and House-fly
tldr: The author examines the mechanism by which the Lacerta Gecko and house-fly are able to adhere to various surfaces, including ceilings and smooth walls, in opposition to gravity. They discover that both animals use a combination of specialized feet and vacua to create adhesion, with the Gecko's feet having unique cavities and the fly's feet having concave surfaces. This research provides insight into the evolutionary adaptations of these animals and their ability to navigate diverse environments.
